intro: Melancranis trigyna, commonly known as the three-lobed melancranis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include slender stems and small, white or pale pink blooms that appear in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
